5248919.trustfund:

5248919.majtheme: Public sector governance,Human development,Financial and private sector development

repnme.cdata!: Lao - Road Maintenance Program (Phase Two) Project

abstracts.cdata!:
This second phase of the Road
            Maintenance Program (RMP2) will expand the operation of
            financing, and management systems for the sustainable
            maintenance of the road networks countrywide, based on the
            successful experience of initiation, and piloting under the
            first phase. The project components are as follows. By
            adopting a programmatic approach, the preservation of the
            road network will support in part, Annual Work Programs, in
            periodic, and routine maintenance, including on selected
            local roads network, and, strengthen quality implementation.
            The capacity building component will support the
            strengthening of the transport sector capacity in two core
            business functions - management and financing of the road
            infrastructure, and, management of road transport and safety
            - as well as the general institutional capacity at both
            national and sub- national levels. Finally, Project
            administration, will support efficient administration of the
            Program, through project monitoring, i.e., strengthening
            project management, reporting, monitoring of project impacts
            and safeguards, and preparation of future sector programs.
            Furthermore, incremental operating costs, include modest
            budget support for project-related activities at central and
            provincial levels, while auditing includes financial and
            technical audits to ensure the quality of project implementation.

repnme.cdata!:
Lao - Road Maintenance Program (Phase Two)
            Project : indigenous peoples plan

abstracts.cdata!:
This Indigenous Peoples Plan (IPP)
            outlines the protection for indigenous people and ethnic
            minorities that may lie outside the primary objectives of
            the project. The project management shall ensure
            coordination with representatives of local communities to
            identify alternative, sustainable production systems, well
            adapted to the needs and environment of ethnic minority
            groups. Based on an assessment of the legal status of
            affected groups, on the country's constitution,
            legislation and regulation, the plan should defend minority
            rights, in particular on the use of, and land development by
            indigenous peoples, and ensure access to natural resources,
            through the customary, or traditional land tenure systems of
            such groups. Monitoring by representatives of indigenous
            groups should be promoted, supported by experienced social
            experts who should report on the adequate process being
            implemented, an evaluation of which should be made available
            to the public.

            Project : indigenous peoples plan

4881545.majtheme: Financial and private sector development,Public sector governance,Human development

repnme.cdata!:
Lao - Road Maintenance Program (Phase Two)
            Project : environmental assessment

abstracts.cdata!:
The Road Maintenance Program (Phase two)
            Project is not expected to cause land acquisition, nor
            resettlement. However, minor infrastructure, or the use of
            some areas as deposits, may result in unexpected low-level
            impacts to parcels of land or buildings, and, road
            maintenance activities may require the temporary occupation
            of plots, potentially causing crops, and income losses to
            settlers along the roads. Nonetheless, the project has been
            assigned an environmental category B. Therefore mitigation
            measures include: the need for setting design standards as
            appropriate for road, traffic, and terrain. This should
            further include an appropriate number of bridges and
            culverts, taking into consideration widening of only one
            side of existing roads, so as to retain trees. Areas where
            roads may affect wildlife, forests, or cultural heritage
            sites, should be avoided as possible in the engineering
            design, and, include protective barriers as needed.
            Moreover, the design shall include restrictions and safety
            warning signs, safe crossings and fences to control
            livestock as necessary. Drainage systems shall be adequately
            designed to control hydrological regimes, potential
            flooding, and irrigation systems, as well as to prevent soil
            erosion, and, in addition septic tanks, and solid waste
            disposal systems should be installed. Adequate wastewater
            treatment facilities should be installed at service areas,
            to prevent water contamination, while air pollution control
            measures shall include regular spraying of construction
            areas, and vegetative propagation to abate as possible dust emissions.

display_title.display_title:
Lao - Road Maintenance Program
            (Phase Two) Project : environmental assessment (Vol. 6) :
            Environmental and social safeguards framework (ESSF)
